name: 蔡明誠
objective:
CALCULUS (I):
This course aims at developing comprehension of derivation and integral、activating capabilities of logic inference and induction、enlightening confidence and independence、strengthening calculating abilities with an emphasis on its application and diagram、furnishing a sound basis for future specialty. The content of Calculus(I)
includes:  Chapter 1 : Functions and Limits   Chapter 2 : Derivatives  Chapter 3 : Inverse Functions   Chapter 4 : Applications of Differentiation   Chapter 5 : Integrals   Chapter 6 : Techniques of Integration
schedule:
Week 1~ 3   : Chapter 1 : Functions and Limits 
Week 4~ 6   : Chapter 2 : Derivatives
Week 7~ 9   : Chapter 3 : Inverse Functions 
Week 10~ 12 : Chapter 4 : Applications of Differentiation
Week13~14  : Chapter 5 : Integrals
Week 15~17  : Chapter 6 : Techniques of Integration
Week 18 : Final exam
scorePolicy:
Attendance: 10%
Quizzes: 10%
Homework: 5%
Tests (not including Midterm and final exams): 25% (twice)
Midterm exam: 20%
Final exam: 30%
materials:
1.Textbook: 
   Essential Calculus Early Transcendentals (2nd edition) 
   Author: James Stewart 

2.Reference book:
   Thomas' Calculus Early Transcendentals (12th edition) 
   Author:  George B. Thomas , Maurice D. Weir , Joel Hass
